ygData.subject: RE: Are we Hybrids?
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes I too would agree.  I would much rather not die so easily rather than just waste less time after an inevitable death.  With the current taunting rules I
ygData.messageBody:
Yes I too would agree. I would much rather not die so easily rather than
just waste less time after an inevitable death. With the current taunting
rules I have given up totally on pickup groups. All it takes is one screwup
by anyone in a pickup group and most of the casters, who have little loyalty
to their groupmates, gate out. The melee guys aren't being targeted anyhow
so usually make it out. As the main focus of mob anger I however end up
buying the farm. Nothing like having group leader scream "Bad Pull,
everyone zone!", only to see 3 casters gate out and 2 melee types including
the puller run for the zone while the horde of critters bears down on you.
Note to the wise, Lullaby will not save you from a train of 12 familiars in
Mistmoore at level 21. Neither will Accelerando. Not to mention the
Deathly Ancilles train that got me later when the casters gated out right in
front of me with nary a word. Needless to say I need a bigger ignore list
now.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Mike.Langlois@... [mailto:Mike.Langlois@...]
Sent: Thursday, January 20, 2000 12:54 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Are we Hybrids?


From: Mike.Langlois@...




Aye, that's exactly what I wanted when I started this thread. I'd much
rather
be a real Hybrid with additional _defensive_ skills, rather than given
bind.

But I'll take either. The end of the original post says that we get the
downside of both types. Fixing either is fine with me :)

Golias, Sol Ro


============================================
From: "Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)" <Michael.Garramone@...>

i think he is using a bind argument in order to really say we could use just
1 more defensive skill, such as parry. i agree that we should get parry and
have it capped around the same as our dodge (125?). it would just put us
one very small notch towards a melee class, which i do think we are far more
than a cleric or shaman. i've always thought we should not get bind, and
all the reasons for and against have already been gone over a million times.

Shada Bladestorm, L50 Wood Elf Bard
Tyria Sarkin, L37 High Elf Wizard
<Afterlife> Mithaniel Marr Server
